comments:
Reporter: Brook Zhang
OS:  RHEL WS 3.0 -GTK & Windows 2003 Standard Edition
Language: CHS/CHT/Korean
Build level: 200404071510(wswb-I20040407-200404121624)   
JDK Version: IBM JDK 1.4.2 Beta
Test case #:  CS18
Summary: DBCS:Context search NLclass can't work well in C/C++ Search
 
Description:
Steps to recreate problem:
1-Create a Standard C/C++  project with <NLprojectCPP> name
2-In the C/C++ Project View, right click on the <NLprojectCPP>,Select New--
>Class.
3-Enter <NLclass> name with DBCS characters and check Inline and Include 
guard,and click Finish.
4-Add a method <NLmothod> in <NLclass>.cpp and Select this method in Outline 
View.Then you can see the method is highlighted in <NLclass>.cpp
5-Right click on the highlight and select Selection Search-->References--
>Workspace form the context menu.

<<Error>>   
         DBCS:In the Search View,There are no found
<<Expected Result>>
         DBCS:Selected Search string show in search view correctly.

Set dependency upon 58232 : once Bogdan investigates that I will triage these 
similar defects accordingly.
Works for me with what is currently in CVS HEAD.

I found that when Select "Selection Search"-->"References"-->"Workspace" form 
the context menu.The old search view is poped up.But no item be found.The error 
occur in console :

This defect is verified on new 200404190838(wswb-I20040422-
200404231600),because the *.cpp can't open by C editor(see bug 59898),So the 
search don't work.Reopen it.

Assigning to Kleo, rumour has it he's taking care of figuring out how to 
deliver a workbench build where this is working.
This defect also exist on build IES3.0-20040429(CDT 20040428).

This is the same bug as 61570 reported from the BIDI testing - the issue is 
search not working for methods that contain NL characters.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 61570 ***
